comments.commentBody: One thing to keep in mind with Obama's negative rating is that there are many people out there who disapprove of him and the democrats in congress because they aren't liberal enough.  I have a blue dog congressman and although I disagree with him at times I am not going to vote for the red faced free market guy running against him.  The GOP has no new ideas, just dissent.

To #4 and like-minded individuals: Those are some accusations! President Obama and incompetent buffoon? Democrats dumb? Do you mean when they prevented the collapse of the global economy with their stimulus package? Or when they passed the healthcare or Wall Street reform bills? Or when they extended unemployment benefits? Or because they are winding down our intervention in Afghanistan and their leadership in repealing "Don't Ask, Don't Tell"?

This President and Congress get things done; unfortunately, they have the most monumental mess in the history of the nation to clean up - a mess created by the previous Republican Administration and Congress -- a mess which the Republicans serving currently are doing their best to keep alive, at the expense of the American people.

Patience and focus are needed, as well as our support of President Obama and the Democrats in Congress. This is how we will get through this; a Repubican majority in Congress will only set us back, perhaps permanently. This nation just got its groove back; let's not subvert ourselves by voting back into Congress the wreckers that caused this disaster!

I am less upset with Republican policies than I am with their attempts to insult my intelligence by continually stating they are fiscal conservatives and believe in a limited Federal government.

Not withstanding this poll, I believe when voters enter the voting booth - their memory will return. If not, and Republicans gain majority in House and/or Senate, heaven help us all!
so, does signing a two-page form really quickly protect against head injuries?

What is it with private companies? They spend millions lobbying to be free of government influence (mainly taxes and regulations), but Boeing wants to be gov't subsidized to get into space tourism! We already have private companies like SpaceX and Virgin Galactic funding their own space tourism ventures. If Boeing wants to make money from space tourism, let them pay for it.

As far as NASA, they need to be funded for their real missions- space research and exploration. The U.S. can only benefit from expanding into space for clean energy, metals mining, and eventually colonization. Earth is beautiful, but too small for our species. Dream big.

Einstein's definition of insanity was doing the same thing over and over again and expecting a different result. Americans across the land need to understand that the change they hoped for needs to be changed again if there is to be any hope of extricating the nation from the persistent near double digit unemployment and a move back to properous times. Thus far the plans of the Democrats are to raise taxes during a stubborn recession--something that is counter-intuitive and destined to make things even worse. It is time to stop the envy and hatred of very successful people, pitting the more affluent against the less affluent. We need to prime the pumps of private enterprise, increase rather than discourage capital formation (by raising taxes on capital gains and dividend interest) and encourage businesses to expand. But businesses will only do so if consumer and customer demand increases.

The only sustainable surefire way to do this is via across the board tax cuts. Targeted temporary tax cuts and incentives are nothing more than a bandaid that after awhile loses its grip and falls off.

We need moderate Republicans, Independents and centrist Democrats who support free enterprise, in the tradition of John F. Kennedy and Ronald Reagan, to get America working again.
At last!  A legitimate reason to become very very rich!  ;-)
Can they send the US congress and their rich patrons to another galaxy- and let the rest of us live again?

Did anyone else find the title misrepresentative of the content of this article. I was expecting an article about Boeing's plans for space flight. The article is mostly about the NASA budget and the differences between presidential, House, and Senate initiatives.

Note: George Lovenguth was selected due to his Marine Corps aircrew experience in Vietnam, his being a licensed FAA Advanced Ground Instrutor - Instrument (IGI0, and his research and writing abilities as he holds an English Literature degree from Thomas Edison State College in New Jersey.  Lovenguth know the world of aviation.  Boeing staff need a real deal person for their real deal space flight.  Wecome aboard.  No luggage needed.  It's about time an American company like Boeing returned to the space adventures isn't it?  America needs to move upward and forward after so many years of fear and well, more fears.  This is a superb morale booster for the whole planet.  Boeing is indeed the leader in all things airworthy.  Good luck Mr. Lovenguth - looking forward to reading your review of the Boeing spacecraft and flight.

expect a 2 year delay at the gage based on current development by boeing...

but we really need a hypersonic system to do this right...

Ah, what the hell.  We're all going to die and run out of money pretty soon, so why not hedge our bets on "Space Travel" instead of ending "terrorism".   Tell me who's got the game on and I'll lay down some cash.  At least I'm comfortable in knowing that I'll never see the results.  We're all suckers in this game of illusion.
What's wrong with that? Send me a ticket please! Thank you!

You need another American revolution only this time get rid of YOUR government, not the British.

The US Congress and the Presidency both represent the wealthy who buy them and even the Supreme Court has enabled this.

President Eisenhower who warned against the rise of the (Congressional) Military Industrial Complex was a Republican and an honest, far-seeing man who cared for the USA. I doubt he could get nominated for a Republican mayor today.

The MIC has taken over. The American empire is condemned to never ending wars it cannot afford. Greatness is gone.

I was proud to do a PhD at an elite US University and I was a fervent English supporter of the USA from childhood. It will be sad to see you gone. We can only hope that the Chinese and the Indians will provide good world leadership.

At the risk of repeating myself, when you contrast what has been accomplished in a year and a half with those of the Republicans and Tea Party in the past nine and a half years, it's a contest only because of the unrelenting anger and lies streaming from the far right.

As for the "Victories" trumpeted by the Tea Party (TPs for short), they did manage to steal some electoral slots from the "approved" Republican candidates. Fun, and amusing, but it doesn't automatically translate into more votes in November. Their very enthusiasm actually shows how little affect they are going to have.

It's a safe bet that the TP’s votes give us an accurate estimate of their numbers. And, they aren’t likely to grow much more since most of those attracted by their beliefs are already involved (and probably voted in the primary). So don’t expect a legion of silent supporters providing a groundswell of votes.

Obviously TPs were already voting for Conservatives, so they brought in no new Republican voters. In fact, they’ve shown how weak many of the traditional Republican Candidates really are, not to mention their dissatisfaction with the Party Line.

TP supported candidates also tend to be novices, extremists and have more baggage. This has a dual effect, since their candidates are more vulnerable and the “wingnut factor” tends to alienate and motivate otherwise passive Moderates.

In the end, all the noise and “success” is stirring up the non-Republicans as well. We’ll find out in November whether or not the TP is actually Beckenstein’s Monster.

And the windows must be on the other side. Cause they sure ain't on the side facing the viewer on the exterior rendering. Are they providing pin holes or something to look out of?

Also, midair launch staging is where it's at. High altitude motherships; balloons. I don't see that happening with this scheme. Why?

What this poll tells me is that poisonous efforts to portray the tea party activists as largely white middle-aged racists isn't working. I think there is widespread understanding about the depth and intensity of the opposition to what is happening in Washington because it is clear our government isn't working properly. But where are the reforms at the Securities and Exchange Commission in the wake of the disclosure that SEC investigators were told about Bernie Madoff in 2002? Which general has been court-martialled for mis-burying more than 200 veterans at Arlington Cemetery? Where is the accountability for the Department of Education in the wake of the  failure to get student testing results to improve? Why is unemployment still at 9.7 percent and why does no one seem to care that there are 16 percent of the workforce now unemployed (if discouraged workers are included). Who is happy with the course our government is taking? This outburst called the tea party is regarded by our political leaders as being anti-Obama, but I think it is much broader and is a backlash against a government that showed it couldn't respond effectively to Hurricane Katrina in New Orleans, and was powerless to deal with an oil spill in the Gulf of Mexico. What is wrong with voters asking for a government that works? We are very used to politicians asking for our votes with pledges to go to Washington, shake things up and make Washington work again. Today it is a fringe group called the tea party that is saying they have politicians who mean it when they make those promises.

Of course, anyone might benefit. I was a liberal Republican. That party betrayed me decades ago, but I did vote for Republicans when I could. I became an Independent in January 2001, after just weeks shy of 40 years as a Republican, even though President Reagan appalled me. Now, I vote for Democrats when they seem to support what I like but I do not support them automatically. President Obama has not earned my vote.

President Obama has supported investment bankers, companies that manufacture war materiel, people who talked President George W. Bush into two unwise wars, and other stuff that I do not like. He sold out to health insurance companies. He has done nothing for me. I mention that in 2005, I earned around $36,000. My income last year was $13,000. What did I gain having him as president?

And, somehow, the Twins have done all this without Joe Nathan, who's been out all season, and without Justin Morneau, who kept them afloat during the first half.  No doubt about it: they've got the best organization in baseball.

I had the unforgettable pleasure of seeing Rostropovich live at the Shrine Auditorium in L.A. in the early 60's. While his playing is superb, his presence is electrifying. He would rock back and forth with the music as tjough there was too much energy to be contained within his body. I was delighted to see his name appear in this puzzle. It brought back an experience I truly relish. I'm not surprised to see that today's constructor is a guitarist. The guitar and 'cello are musical soul mates. Their registers, and even their sonorities are similar. 'Cello works by Bach and Boccherini, for example, fall perfectly within the range of the guitar, and, of course, contemporary guitar repertoire has been enriched by the compositions of Villa-Lobos, whose instrument was the 'cello. (Bachianas Brasilieras #1 for eight 'celli is well worth hearing.) Thanks for the memories.

We see aspects of ourselves in our presidents. That is why we vote for them. They embody our ambiguities and faults as well as our ideals and dreams.

No president achieves everything desirable. I respect those who have held the office during my life. President Roosevelt was, as Isaiah Berlin noted, a fox. President Truman stumbled into the Korean debacle but he also kept it from becoming much worse that is was. He got the Marshall Plan done. He accomplished some positive things at the beginning of the Cold War but set up other problems that haunted us later. He also saw thought Billy Graham—something no other president seems to have done.

President Eisenhower had a mixed record. I deeply admired him. He made awful mistakes in overturning governments, especially democratically elected ones. Those mistakes still haunt us, but he understood the character of his time and the menace of nuclear war (at least, he seemed to have grasped that menace). President Kennedy was an illusion in some ways, but, in an odd way, one who sometimes acted wisely.

President Nixon let his deputies institute some excellent domestic policies, while he blew much in the realm of foreign policy, though, even there, he had his moments. President Ford did not get to act freely. His great mistake was letting Mr. Nixon off the hook but that was, perhaps, a humane act. President Carter was not up to the job. Intelligence did not make him an effective president.

President Reagan undermined government. He was as an awful president—much overrated. President George H. W. Bush seemed almost competent, except that he lost control of the deficit. President Clinton was a closet conservative. He did reduce spending and reversed the deficit. The way the Supreme Court elected George W. Bush undermined constitutional government. The current president seems clueless. What is wrong with him? He seemed full of promise. He had majorities in both houses of the Congress. He had a mandate for change. He blew it.

Where are the leaders? Where are people like Richard Lugar when we need him? The Republicans collapsed into the brain dead demagoguery of Dr. Gingrich. The Democrats collapsed into the empty campaign gloss of Professor Obama. I am ready to vote for my ca, but she died in 1989!

"If one were to measure the views with Marxist views on the far left on the scale and capitalist views on the right, then Obama would be much closer to Marxism on the scale than he would be to capitalism." - comrade greenhorn

Hey, quick question for you. Do you think regulated power utility companies and the jobs derived there from are closer to (A) marxism or (B) capitalism?

Please just give and (A) or (B) answer .. not answering means you really don't have a clue what you are talking about but like doubling the bogeymen in your closet with scary marxists and scarrrrry terrorists Muslims.

comments.userLocation: Cowtown, The Real United States of Texas
comments.commentBody:
Tea Party or Republican Party ---the Tsunami that will drown Obama and his socialist Party in November has begun.

Just like Sen. Joe L. (CT) meets with the Dems...any Dem that goes down in November is a win.

+1

If the Tea Party is anti-neo-CON and its agenda is to bring more balance between Wall Street & Main Street to promote a better life for those that want it, i'm on board...one exception, Sarah Palin; an empty suit can't be its poster grizzly mama.

O'Donnell sees Republicans in the bushes. This may be our next Congressperson, America. This Democrat is scared that she is going to win.

Joe Biden needs to get to Delaware NOW and start campaigning for Chris Coons.
